lines.text: The marital bed is the death of love!
This comedy might have been a tragedy but the gods were kind. The teacher of this lesson is neither the author nor the actors, but life itself with its absurd twists.
You're a beast! Spoilt, brutal, cynical. A gynecologist who knows nothing about women!
I'm not a passionate he-man, but a tired wretch full of remorse.
HELL!
No disturbing symptoms. But I'd better examine you. Please get undressed.
Do you think I'm pretty?
What's it like to see women undressing all day? I'm so scared. You'll be nice to me?
Get undressed, others are waiting.
It's delicious when you scold me!
If I were to have an affair with you what a terrible chain reaction there would be.
Nobody need know.

I prefer my simple life with its small joys and cares, my slippers by the quiet fire, to your perfumed body and devouring flame that sweeps over home, children, decency and leads to nothing at all. Go now, Susanne. Leave me in peace.
You love me.
No. But I desire you. I want your fire to burn away my dull apathy and the waste heap of grey monotony. Is that absurd and silly?
Don't talk. Kiss me.
It's my inalienable right to go on being a bore.
Infidelity is an invention of moralists and gossips.
Of course I noticed you last summer. Your fragrance was everywhere I dreamt of you. You were summer itself.
Maybe God's a woman.
Woman is life itself with its delights and miseries.
Some book. Modern literature, eh?
"Arterial Circulation in the Womb and Secondary Sex-Glands and Their Functions"
With pictures, eh?
Yes, but dull ones.
Could I have a light?
[Traveling Salesman rushes to light her cigarette]
What a woman! What lips, what a bosom! She seems interested.
In what?
In me, of course.
Can you operate on a woman and make her a man? The papers say it's possible. Operate on me! I'm sick of being a woman.
Have you seen my hands? I want to make something - not just sun-bathe, read silly magazines and think about love.
Mummy's so nervous. It's not good for a mature woman to be without a man.

My best friend Eva, we've always been chums. She was to spend the summer here and we were going to swim and fish and have fun. She's changed and uses lipstick and curlers and wiggles her hips in a swim-suit a size too small. She with her great fat behind! Everything I wanted to do she said was silly.
Mummy naturally has a lover when you have a mistress.
We try to be ourselves and find we're other people too.
Life at its best is cooperation.
But love's stupid!
Not the real kind. But to wallow in physical love is to be like the baboons.
Then you're a baboon.
Maybe.
I often think what power a gynecologist has over women. Don't you ever feel tempted?
Women adore being married.
How naive.
A woman wants to feel she's a woman - not a wife. It's for the husband to find out how.
A job for millionaires.
A hobby for men.
Your virtue is impregnable.
What do you know of my virtue? Woman is not virtuous by nature. You men have created virginity and virtue, chastity and innocence.
Amen.
No! Not at all. A man can be immoral and he's only a "he-man". But a woman who satisfies her instincts is a strumpet.
You think the fruit is yours for the taking, but it will be a very sour apple. Some things I don't easily forget.
What is love anyway? A strenuous grimace which ends in a yawn.
How cynical.
Your own words.
Fiddlesticks! Tommyrot!
Let's not lose a single day, night or hour. Give me back your heart - - I'll tend to it like a holy relic. My darling!
You little minx!
Don't let that silly kiss give you ideas. My mind's made up. Never again!
Never again what?
I don't know. But never again.
Something must have happened to her.
The bride's always late. She has a lot to do. Settle with her past, take leave of her virginity...
Remember that sunny morning last winter when I was posing for Carl-Adam? The look you gave me!
I saw you naked for the first time.
You blushed so sweetly and that lout said, "And he's to be a gynecologist!"
We must tell Carl-Adam.
He'll kill you.
With every right. I"m his best friend.
Let's make love first.
Marianne, no. Business before pleasure.
What character!

[Marianne and Carl-Adam start fighting]
Peace, my friends!
Who's the injured one? Here am I in my innocence...
Innocent! With girls by the dozen posing both vertically and horizontally. You're a lecherous old goat!
A gentle creature like me was to marry that shrew!
I'm through doing your chores, exposing my superb bust - - through with your stupid art and immorality... your bragging and your idiotic virility!
And I'm sick of your tantrums! Who dragged you out of the gutter? Made you famous? You're not worthy to lick my boots! I've given you bed and board and gin!
Clear out before I kill you and your la-di-da friend!
I'm done with playing the wife. It's a poor part anyway.
Every morning I'll sing of your beautiful body and soul, at noon lay flowers at your feet, at night be the fiery lover.
Sometimes you might have praised my beauty, pretended I was the best lover in the world... though we both know I'm not. Why did we never make-believe?
In this land of perpetual winter? When I'm ashamed of my skinny arms and fat tummy? It's asking too much!
Stop. Have you got your long underwear on?
[Nods his head yes]
You're fibbing.
Must you discuss it in front of everybody? All right, I've short underwear on! It's my birthday.
And tomorrow it'll be your rheumatism. Go and change.
Aren't you afraid of dying?
Not a bit.
Do you believe in God?
If by God you mean life, then I do. I believe in this life and the next, in all kinds of life.
But death?
Just a part of life. How dull if everything was always the same. You die and begin a new life.
Sometimes my body aches for a baby. They smell so nice... Oh, to hold them! To give them the breast! I shudder with delight to think of it!

[David walks up from behind and kisses her neck]
What are you doing?
I love you. I've always loved you. I always will.
Amen.
Women love great artists. Don't they, girlie?
Only impotent men are faithful and they have unfaithful wives.
David! Don't you recognize me? Kiss your little Lise.
I'm going to kiss the prettiest girl in Denmark!
How could you kiss that shameless little slut?
